session_info.name: SAT4B - Working Group 7-Orbit and Beam Stability

papers.title: Impedance and Collective Effects Studies in CEPC
authors: Circular electron-positron collider (CEPC) is a 120GeV storage ring-based collder. Due to the small beam size and high sigle bunch population
the collective effects may bring new challenges to the physical design of the machine. A thorough evaluation of the coupling impedance is necessary in controlling the total impedance of the ring
which can accordingly prevent the occurrence of the beam instability. The primary studies on the impedance and collective effects in CEPC are presented.
